missions.name: Dive
missions.summary: Remove a crime organization from their hostile takeover of Porto

briefing.mission:
The island of Porto have been seized by a crime organization that has been causing havoc for decades. They have occupied the island by force. This hostile takeover has occurred in the last 24 hours, and we are the Quick Reaction Force to take it back.
We anticipate large numbers of enemies in the area, with zero civilians. Anyone in the area during the takeover have either escaped or anticipated dead. The crime organization have made outrageous demands... so their demands will be met with brute force. 
From the bare basic intel provided, the hostile force has torched much of the assets there. They are anticipated to have perhaps one armed truck, but nothing more. There true power and strength comes from their numbers. Proceed accordingly.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Clear the island of enemy occupancy
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Island of Porto
The island of Porto are in dire straits and need a show of force and dominance to retake their island.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Crime Organization
The crime organization on the island have been causing havoc for decades. They've decided to lay waste to the island and claim it as their own. Their strength are in numbers, being armed with rifles, pistols, and submachine firearms.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
All civilians have been either executed or vacated the land. We have full authority to proceed how we wish.

missions.name: Loud and Heavy
missions.summary: Contractors repel a Taliban incursion into Zargabad

briefing.mission:
The city of Zargabad is requesting assistance. The center of the city has been occupied by Taliban forces. Civilians are fleeing for their lives, most making a run for the hills or airfield. The airfield is under the security of Theseus INC. As they hold the airfield, we are tasked with clearing the Taliban insurgents from the civilian homes. 

The Taliban drove into the city, some with mounted guns on the back. They have been seen with RPGs and carrying mounted & static firearms. Be wary walking down the city streets.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Clear the city of Zargabad from the Taliban.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Assist any civilians in need.
briefing.situation:
The streets of Zargabad have been taken over by Taliban forces. They've infilitrated houses and killing anyone in their way. The situation seems dire. 

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
City of Zargabad

The City of Zargabad has called upon us to help assist in their time of need.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
The Taliban

The Taliban are well known, often using force to spread their ideology and beliefs. There are reports of them being equipped with small arms, RPGs, vehicles, and some statics weaponry.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Theseus INC PMC
Location(s): Western Airfield, Northern Military Base

Theseus INC has been contracted to act as security for the airfield. They will continue to protect the airfield as we push throughout the city.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present in the area and may or may not be in support of either Synixe Contractors, Theseus INC, or the Taliban.

missions.name: Running On Empty
missions.summary: With a ION PMC unit rogue and off the grid, Synixe is hired to respond and assist

briefing.mission:
The Takistani Government has called upon our help. They're having issues with the Taliban in recent memory. ION PMC is in the area and have it on good authority (and intel) that the Taliban are looking to target infastructure, mainly oilfields. ION PMC is spread thin protecting the areas, and are unable to check in with a squad who has gone radio silent. That's where Synixe comes in.

We are tasked with going to the Par-e Siah oilfield and to check on the squad. While ION PMC prays for just a miscommunication, we should be prepared to clear out any enemies that we come into contact with. If you wish, ION PMC has a mutual FOB at Lalezar and are willing to provide two (2) HMG off roads and a MSE-3 Marid (HMG). They have the supplies, just not the manpower.

If things have taken a turn for the worst, we are asked to recover those alive or dead and bring them to this FOB. Also, if possible, check the infastructure to make sure everything is in tip top shape.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Check on the ION PMC squad at the Par-e Siah oilfield.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Clear infastructure of any hazards, specifically explosives.
Bring back any alive or fallen ION PMC members.
briefing.situation:
The oil fields of Takistan are under threat from the Taliban. With a ION PMC unit rogue and off the grid, Synixe is hired to respond and assist.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Takistani Government
The Takistani Government has been dealing with Taliban forces for decades. A constant thorn in the side of the government, these terrorist forces are focused on ruining the oil infastructure to disrupt drilling.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
The Taliban
The Taliban are well known, often using force to spread their ideology and beliefs. There are reports of them being equipped with small arms, RPGs, vehicles, and some statics weaponry.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
ION PMC
Location(s): FOB at Lalezar, Par-e Siah oilfield, other oil fields in the region.
ION PMC has been contracted to act as security for numerous oilfields. With one ION PMC group going radio silent, we are called to help and investigate with their numbers spread thin.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present in the area and may or may not be in support of either Synixe Contractors, ION PMC, or the Taliban.

missions.name: Take It Slow
missions.summary: Contractors go hunt religious militants in the jungle

briefing.mission:
The local government have been surveilling a religious, born again, militant group that is stationed deep in the woods. They seem to have been collecting information and devising some sort of future plan. We have been called upon to figure out the what. Recover whatever you can find and carry and bring it back to base, while clearing out the areas marked on your maps.
We are approaching their neck of the woods. The jungle is thick and the terrain is unknown. This doesn't favor us in the slightest so take it slow and proceed with caution.
The government has provided you a Little Bird to help you in your endeavors. Good luck.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Recover any intel at the areas marked.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Clear enemies stationed at each location.
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Local Government
The local government in the region has called upon us to help assist in their time of need. This religious cult is their main priority and something feels off.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Religious Militant Group
Crazed gunmen who believe their cause is worth dying for, and will do anything to achieve it.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present in the area, but shouldn't be expected to partake in the areas marked on the map.

missions.name: Law and Order
missions.summary: Contractors' vacation meets a not so quiet end...

briefing.mission:
Just an hour ago, Syndikat launched a surprise offensive in eastern Tanoa. Taking advantage of our pullout from the region, Syndikat groups have taken of control of several sites including the Blue Pearl port and Red Spring mine in effort to gain control of the island.

As one of the few remaining squads in Tanoa, link up with local Gendarmerie forces and take back those sites. Local forces are planning a counter attack at 0700. Additional reaction forces are either securing other targets in the region or are enroute.

Although only a short time has passed, Syndikat has total control of the AO especially towards the port. Be wary of ambushes and roadblocks, they are likely expecting our counter attack.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure the town of Vagalala
- Secure the Red Spring mine
- Secure Blue Pearl port

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Rescue any civilians/Gendarmerie captured by Syndikat
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Horizon Islands Republic
Location: Horizon Islands

The Horizon Islands Republic is a country located in the South Pacific, comprised of several archipelagos. At one point in time, this country was frought with crime and terrorism led by a faction called the Syndikat.But, with the support of Synixe, this is no longer the truth. With the situation stablizing, their contract with Synixe draws to a close until now.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Syndikat
Location: Eastern Tanoa

Until now, Syndikat's prescense in the region has been relatively low to non-existent in previous months. Tanoa's dense jungles make their activities difficult to track. Comprised of criminials and paramilitary groups, their armaments ranges from the late 1900s to early 2000s. Furthermore, their diverse composition makes their true motives for fighting unknown. Whatever is the case, recent reports have noted their renwed strength and agressive tactics capturing towns and critical infastructure in eastern Tanoa. With news of Synixe's exit from the Horizon Islands, Syndikat may have just found a new opporunity to gain some ground.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Gendarmerie
Location: Tanoa

A militarized police force that maintains law and order mostly in Tanoa. They are clearly identified by their medium blue colors and military-style caps. Working alongside Synixe contractors, Gendarmerie have been making ground shutting down Syndikat activities in the region.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Tanoan Citizens
Location: Tanoa

Formerly a French colony, Tanoans proudly follow the flag of the Horizon Islands Republic. Due to how fast Syndikat took over, some civilians may still be trapped in the region.

missions.name: Backdrafts
missions.summary: Contractors take down a fortified human trafficking cartel after the police are pushed back under heavy fire

briefing.mission:
The Serrano Cartel, experts in international drug and human trafficking, have long headed their operations from Sahrani, although very little physical operations have been conducted on the island. The Sahrani National Police, long innefective due to corruption, have recently been reformed and after two years, attempted to arrest Elías Serrano, the cartel's leader.

Unfortunate for the police, the cartel was much more prepared than anticipated, with many mercenaries and cartel members ready to defend Serrano. The police were quickly overwhelmed, and the cartel has since fortified their position in the North West corner of Ortego.

It is expected that a cartel extraction team is on the way with plans to extract Serrano from Sahrani. We have been contracted to prevent his escape and to secure him for the Sahrani National Police. The police have set up roadblocks north and south of Ortego, but they are not prepared for a full assault on the cartel's position.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure Elías Serrano
- Defeat the cartel forces
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Sahrani National Police

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Serrano Cartel
Location: Ortego

Surprisingly well-equipped and organized, they are heavily fortified in the North West corner of Ortego.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Sahrani National Police
Location: Roadblocks north and south of Ortego

After attempting to arrest Elías Serrano, the national police were completely unprepared for the cartel's response.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Most civilians have fled or are hiding in their homes. The cartel is very feared and has a reputation for violence if they are crossed.

missions.name: Bed and Break Fast
missions.summary: Contractors must rescue a hostage from separtists before it is too late

briefing.mission:
An important local figure in Korsac, Olaf Pawlik, has been kidnapped by separatists, and it is feared he will be extracted to Russia very soon.

Pawlik reportedly gave shelter to a man who's car broke down in the city of Rostok, where Pawlik lives. In the morning, a car sped up to Pawlik's house, and the unknown man escorted Pawlik out of the house and into the vehicle at gunpoint. The car sped off, and it's route has been marked based on civilian reports.

A police force was dispatched to the area, but took fire from separatists forces and have had to retreat. We have been tasked with moving into the area, and securing Pawlik before it is too late.

If we are able to, document any evidence of Russian involvement in the kidnapping, as this would be a major diplomatic incident.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Find Olaf Pawlik before he is extracted

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Document proof of Russia's involvement in the kidnapping
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Korsac Police
Location: Rostok, retreated from the AO

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Separatists
Location: South of Rostok

A well armed militia group, highly suspected to be backed and resourced by Russia.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Korsac Police

missions.name: Brass Meteor
missions.summary: Contractors help the overwhelmed Karzeghistanis with multiple objectives

briefing.mission:
The overwhelmed Karzeghistani military has requested our assistance in moving supplied to its battered outposts, and securing transporting a very important VIP.

Local terrorist forces have been attacking civilians and Karzeghistani positions in the AO, and have recently aquired 8x mortar tubes from at ambushed Karzeghistani convoy.

Reinforcing the Karzeghistani positions and destroying or recovering the mortars will go a long way to stablize civilian life in the region.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Transport Suhaim Jouahri to Lugopa Airfield
- Deliver 6x Food Bags to each Karzeghistani outpost
- Secure or destroy 8x stolen mortars

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Assist the Karzegistani outposts if they are under attack
- Support the security of IDAP, if encountered and in danger

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Avoid dragging firefights into major population centers
- Avoid contact with IDAP if they are not in danger
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Karzeghistani Military
Location: Lugopa Airfield

Identifiable by their western weapons and green flag. Trained and supported by a NATO mission in the region, but struggling to keep up with terrorist forces attacking their outposts.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Terrorist Forces
Location: Marked areas, everywhere

Their mortar locations have been narrowed down to 3 areas, but they may be present anywhere in our AO.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Karzeghistani Military
Location: Multiple Marked Outposts, Outside AO

Identifiable by their western weapons and green flag. Due to recent heavy attacks, they are all in their outposts, no patrols currently.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: IDAP
Location: Unknown

Has run small humanitarian operations in the area, but they may or may not be present currently due to the security situation.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present nearly everywhere, will have varying allegiances, most are just focused on surviving the conflict.

missions.name: The Contractys
missions.summary: Contractors fly to South Africa

missions.name: Cures
missions.summary: Contractors secure 2 IDAP workers that have vanished

briefing.mission:
Two IDAP workers that were running medical operations in Tanoa's isolated villages have gone missing under mysterious circumstances.

We have been contracted by the Tanoan Government to investigate the disappearance of these two workers, and to secure them.

We have been given supplies that need to be delivered to 5 different villages, by giving them their supplies, they may be willing to give us information.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure Charlie Warren
- Secure Donald Hughes
- Deliver the supplies to the 5 villages

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Eliminate the hostile forces that pose a threat to the villages

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Vehicles are not allowed to be used offroad or on foot paths
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Tanoan Government
Location: George Town, Tanoa

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Tanoan Syndicate
Location: Various locations throughout Tanoa

Suspected to be involved in the disappearance of the two IDAP workers, the Tanoan Syndicate is a criminal organization that operates throughout Tanoa. They are known for their ruthless tactics and control over various illegal activities on the island.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Tanoan Gendarmerie
Location: George Town, Tanoa

The Gendarmerie will not be directly involved in the operation, but they are aware of our presence.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: IDAP (International Development and Aid Project)
Location: George Town, Tanoa

The IDAP is an international organization that provides humanitarian aid and development assistance. They have a mission in Tanoa to assist the government with treating villages that have residents not able to travel to the hospital in George Town.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Tanoan Civilians
Location: Various locations throughout Tanoa

Many civilians do not support the Syndicate, but may be too afraid to provide information against them.

missions.name: Deadlines
missions.summary: Contractors must prevent a strike launch from behind enemy lines

briefing.mission:
The restoration forces are planning a major offensive, western intelligence has learned, and information has been passed on to the government forces. They are planning to launch an artillery attack from a former training facility, now knows as FOB Åbo.

The government forces are mainly made up of recent volunteers, and are not well trained, and the number of career soldiers is low. Therefor, they have requested assistance from the Synixe Contractors.

No support is available from the government forces, and we will be operating behind enemy lines. With help from an informant, we have been able to get into the region, and have been provided with a van and truck to use for the operation.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Prevent the restoration forces from launching their artillery attack from the former training facility at FOB Åbo.

The attack is planned to be launched at 0530, just as dawn is breaking.
If you are discovered, they may request to launch the attack early.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Destroy as much of the restoration forces' equipment as possible.

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
Synixe vehicles were not able to be transported to the AO.
briefing.situation:
Starting 4 years earlier, a "restoration" movement grew in support across the western region of the country. Creating a new political party, they were vying for reform to a nationalist government to "restore the nation".
They formed small militias and prepared in small groups to defend themselves from the government. After one of their party leaders was arrested for treason, the movement began an armed uprising against the government.
Initially the movement secured a decent amount of territory, but the government forces were able to organize, and the conflict has primarily been cold since, with only small amounts of territory changing hands.
Most civilians that did live in the west have moved to the far east of the country, away from the fighting and firmly under government control.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Government Forces
Location: Front Lines (Not in AO)

The government forces are attempting to suppress the uprising, and have requested assistance from the Synixe PMC.
None of their forces are currently in the AO.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Restoration Forces
Location: Front Lines, FOB Åbo, possibly patrolling the AO

Now being supported by the Russian Federation.
They are well equipped, but poorly trained and low in numbers.
They are currently attempting to launch an artillery attack from the former training facility at FOB Åbo.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Location: Throughout the AO

Very small numbers of civilians remain throughout the AO, but should not be near FOB Åbo.
Civilians mostly keep to themselves, but will likely support or possibly the restoration forces if they are present.
Since our operation is at night, they should not be a major concern.

missions.name: Dropping
missions.summary: Contractors parachute into Kujari to retake a military airfield under rebel control

briefing.mission:
The Kujari Military has been dealing with foreign sponsored rebel groups for the past few years.

The Islamic Revolution in Kujari (IRK) is well equipped, and have recently sent a force around the front lines to an airfield in a historically peaceful region.

If they are allowed to keep control of the airfield, they will be able to land supplies from thier foreign sponsors, and quickly take the large cities in the region.

The Kujari Military does not have resources in the region to divert, and have hired us to take control of the airfield before too many supplies have landed.

An air reconnaissance drone has confirmed the presence of infantry, light vehicles, a helicopter, and at least one large ground asset.

Due to the airfields remote nature, we have partnered with a local tour company to provide us with a trip in while raising hopefully little suspicion.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure the Airfield

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Destroy any Anti-Air assets

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Do not let the tour company's connection be discovered
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Kujari Government
Location: Kujari (Outside of the AO)

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Islamic Revolution in Kujari (IRK)
Location: North East of the Region

The IRK is a well equipped force, with access to light helicopters, APCs, IFVs, and large number of trucks and infantry.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Kujari Military
Location: Outside of the AO

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Kujari Civilians
Location: Major cities near the AO

Varying allegiance to the IRK or Miltary

missions.name: Ekhoes In The Night
missions.summary: Contractors investigate militia messing with the decommisioned Comms Ekho

briefing.mission:
Comms Ekho, a small decommisioned signals intelligence base has recently begun emitting signals around 0100.

The Korsac Police have been unable to determine who or why people have been entering the facility, but they suspect it is tied to separatist terrorist groups that have been active in recent months.

The Korsac Police is not equipped or trained for such operations, especially at night. They have hired us to secure the site and destory any old military assets that may be useful to the extremist groups.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure Comms Ekho
- Destroy Military Assets at Comms Ekho

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Determine any terrorist operating locations
- Secure all identified terrorists

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Minimize conflict near civilian centers
briefing.situation:
Livonia, after surviving many years of Russian sponsored violence in the 2020s, is now a more peaceful and secure nation, while still dealing with some domestic terrorist threats.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Livonia Government
Location: Livonia

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Pro-Russian Separatists
Location: Scattered throughout Livonia

During the 2020s, they were a major threat to the region. After being defeated, they are considered more of a domestic terrorist threat rather than a military threat.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Korsac Police
Location: Korsac Region

Since military restructuring in 2029, the Korsac Police have been responsible for the region's seccurity.

missions.name: The Doctor & Me
missions.summary: Contractors are hired to provide security after two researchers at a civilian research facility working on a military contract have gone missing

briefing.mission: Provide security to the facility, look for evidence surrounding the disappearance of Dr. Łukasz Wojciechowski & Felix Montgomery
briefing.objectives: Follow the instructions of Dr. Oliver Sedgewick.
briefing.situation: A facility conducting a military research contract has recently had two of their lead researchers go missing, we have been tasked with providing security to the facility. Comply with all orders from staff, as we are not privy to the details of the research being conducted.

missions.name: Harmonics
missions.summary: Contractors track down and destroy communication jamming equipment that is hampering CT operations

briefing.old:
**Harmonics** **Employer**
Gunzkili National Police **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Militia & Terrorist Cell
Disrupt communications and operations

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Gunzkili National Police

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
Local Police

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians may be present outside of cities, although the rural areas are unsafe and civilians are unlikely to stray far from major centers.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Very flat, swamps. **Mission**
A terror cell has been deploying jammers for military radio, cellphones, and Wifi devices throughout the region in an attempt to disrupt the National Police Counter-Terrorism Unit's ability to receive civilian reports and respond.

We have been tasked with tracking down nefarious devices causing interference.
It is recommended to have EOD on this mission.
We have aquired Spectrum Devices that can detect a wide range of frequencies, and help determine their location.

A list of common frequencies ranges has been provided.

Note: Contact DLC is required to use the Spectrum Device.

Primary Objectives:
- 2x Area of reported Cellphone jamming (Purple)
- 1x Area of reported Wifi / Bluetooth jamming (Yellow)
- Unknown count of military radio jammers

Second Objectives:
- Engage any threats encountered near civilian locations

missions.name: Hide and Seek
missions.summary: Contractors must secure and extract a high value target

briefing.mission:
Our client has hired us to secure Ivan Petrska. His last known region is marked on your maps.

We don't expect him to come willingly, but we need him alive.

Extraction will occur at 1400 hours, be ready. Once Ivan is secured in the civilian helicopter, you have 30 seconds before the escort leaves.

Unfortunately, we are not the only ones after him.

Good luck, Synixe Contractors.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure Ivan Petrska Alive

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Do not attract attention from other factions

missions.name: Leaks
missions.summary: Chernarus police receive a tip from inside a separatist movement

briefing.mission:
The Chernarus Police have received a tip from inside a separatists movement about an plan to attack 6 targets throughout the region.

A chemical shipment was brought into the port of Elektrozavodsk, and was moved to an unknown location to create bombs.

The CI (Mikhail Mikhaylova) doesn't know the bomb factory or the targets, but is involved at a secondary location used as an armoury and safehouse.

We are being provided vehicles and a chemical detection equipment to help us locate the bombs.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Eliminate the bomb threat from the separatists
- Eliminate the separatist safehouse

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Secure the CI (Mikhail Mikhaylova)
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Chernarus National Police

Providing us with vehicles and chemical detection equipment to help locate the bombs.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Chernarus Separatists
Location: Unknown

Well armed and equipped, use terror tactics to achieve their goals. Police have turned a CI (Mikhail Mikhaylova) on the inside.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Chernarus National Police
Location: Elektrozavodsk

Investigative police force, requesting our assistance due to our ability to deal with the unusual and dangerous situation.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians may be sympathetic to the separatists, but are not expected to be hostile. They may tip off the separatists to our movements.

missions.name: Logging
missions.summary: Contractors disrupt a well armed militia from launching an attack

briefing.mission:
A CSAT backed militia is trying to gain power in the region, and CSAT has recently given them some new toys.

Thanks to information from someone with cold feet, we know the militia has received 2 MLRS systems from CSAT, and we know where they currently are.

We also know that a CSAT officer personally delivered the MLRS systems, and is now at a secondary location. Unfortunately, we don't know the location, but we do know his personal communications device was active just before 0245 hours.

As the closest force able to deploy on short notice, we have been hired to take out the MLRS systems, and implicate CSAT in the process.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Destroy the 2 MLRS systems at the marked location
- Find and implicate the CSAT officer in co-operation with the militia

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Eliminate any encountered hostile militia forces

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Avoid stopping in towns, passing through while not in combat is acceptable
briefing.situation:
Gunkizli is a relatively remote region in Eastern Europe, with many small towns. It has a long history of simmering tensions, especially as Russia and CSAT look to expand their influence in the region. The military has not been able to keep up staffing in the region, and was unprepared for the recent escalation. Many military sites sit abandoned, used by locals, or have been taken over by militias.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Gunkizli Government

Dealing with a local militia with CSAT funding

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Malakas Militia
Location: One marked location, one unknown location

The Malakas Militia is a local group that has recently received support from CSAT. They are well equipped and well trained, and have been causing trouble in the region. Expected to have between 100 and 150 members active in the region.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
The area is not very populated, most civilians will be home sleeping, others will avoid hot zones and remain indoors or near towns.

missions.name: Midst of Madness
missions.summary: Contractors enter the epicenter of a civil war to recover a client's prized possessions

briefing.mission:
As a civil war breaks in Altis, the city of Kavala is under seige by the AAF.

Our client, Mr. Karmanlis, fears that a small group of people after his prized possessions will take advantage of the chaos to steal them.

We have been contracted to secure the items and return them to Mr. Karmanlis, who is safely outside of the city.

He says that 3 men were recently believed to be after his possessions, and that they were wearing Fieldsure backpacks.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Recover the 15x prized possessions from Mr. Karmanlis' residence in Kavala.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Minimize conflict with neutral parties.

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
The AAF have declared a no fly zone over Altis, and will shoot down any aircraft that enter the airspace.
briefing.situation:
The city of Kavala is in chaos, the city has been the epicenter of Altis' looming threat of civil war.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Militidas Karmanlis
Location: Undisclosed, in Altis

A wealthy Kavala resident, he has escaped the city, but now realizes that he has left behind his most prized possession.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Kavala Resistance
Location: Kavala

The Kavala Resistance is a group of civilians who have taken up arms against the Altis Armed Forces.

They are not necessarily hostile to us, but may not identify us as neutral.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Altis Armed Forces
Location: Altis

The Altis Armed Forces are the official military of Altis, they are weak in numbers and struggling to maintain control of the island.

They are not necessarily hostile to us, but may not identify us as neutral.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians will be present in and around Kavala.

missions.name: Miecz i Włócznia
missions.summary: Contractors assist the LDF as they push to capture key towns along a river

briefing.mission:
Livonia is fighting off an incursion of Russian backed forces, The Livonian Protectors, claiming to be liberating the oppressed peoples of many of the country's regions.

The LDF is making progress as they push back the invaders to the North East, but with the Russians supplying the insurgents with heavy vehicles, the progress has slowed. The LP have heavily defened the area around Kinney, holding the critical choke point of the river and its crossings.

The LDF has hired Synixe Contractors to use our expertise in anti-vehicle operations and strategic strikes to help them push the LP back and secure the river crossings.

The ground forces, callsign Włócznia (Spear), will be ready to push and secure the bridges as we eliminate the LP's heavy vehicles and make space for the LDF to advance.

We will be using HAT, MAT, and UAV, and the LDF's mobile artillery, Miecz (Sword), to destroy the LP's heavy vehicles and fortifications.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Eliminate heavy vehicles
- Support the LDF's advance
- Secure the river and its crossings

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Prevent the destruction of LDF vehicles
- Prevent the destruction of LDF artillery
- Prevent the destruction of bridges

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- The LDF is in charge, we must obey their orders
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Livonian Defense Force (LDF)
Location: South of Kinney

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Livonian Protectors (LP)
Location: Kinney and surrounding areas

Russian backed insurgents, heavily armed and equipped with heavy vehicles. They are defending the river crossings and have fortified positions around Kinney.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Spear (Włócznia)
Location: South of Kinney

The LDF's ground forces, supported by Synixe Contractors, are tasked with pushing back the LP and securing the river crossings. They will be using a combination of infantry and armored vehicles.

<font color='#f6a11d'>SUPPORTING FORCES</font>
Name: Sword (Miecz)
Location: South of Kinney

The LDF's mobile artillery unit, providing fire support to the ground forces. They will be used to target LP heavy vehicles and fortifications. We can provide them with coordinates for targets.

missions.name: No More Lamparts
missions.summary: Contractors are brought in by NATO to deal with a bandit problem in a desatibilizing region

briefing.mission:
Summa and Eridonia are two regions of a former Soviet dependant in Eastern Europe that has fallen into a state of civil disarray for the last 7 years. NATO has been trying to stabilize the region, but is trying to avoid putting troops on the ground to avoid political backlash. Initially, NATO hired a PMC called ION Security, but they have been largely ineffective.

A bandit problem has been growing in the region, raiding the local population and old military caches. Are task is to destroy the old military caches and investigate reports of bandit activity, hopefully providing some much needed stability to the people of Summa.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
<marker name="obj1">Destroy the old military caches</marker>
<marker name="obj2">Investigate reports of activity near a military cache</marker>
<marker name="obj3">Clear the bandit stronghold</marker>

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Eliminate any hostile forces near civilians or caches
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: NATO - Operation POSE (Peace Operations in Summa and Eridonia)

NATO has been trying to stabilize a former Soviet dependant in Eastern Europe that has fallen into a state of civil disarray for the last 7 years.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Bandits

Taking advantage of the weakend state of the government, and ample supply of cold war caches, bandits have been raiding the local population and military caches.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: ION Security
Location: FOB Pine

A PMC hired by NATO to help stabilize the region. They have been largely ineffective in stopping the bandit raids. They are unlikely to be outside of FOB Pine.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Local Population

The local population is allowed to carry rifles for the purpose of hunting. They are not to be considered hostile unless they are actively engaging friendly forces.
Many carry their hunting rifles with them due to the rise in bandit activity in the area.

missions.name: No Necessary Measures
missions.summary: Contractors assist islanders against CSAT in a covert CIA/BND operation

briefing.mission:
We have been contracted to covertly support the rebels by completing key objectives.

The operation, being led by the CIA and BND, is to be kept secret from the public.

We have been provided various vehicles to assist us in our mission.

It is imperative that CSAT does not discover our involvement in this operation.

No contractors, bodies, equipment, vehicles, or other evidence may be left behind.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
1. Destroy CSAT's UAV capability
3. Destroy CSAT's air superiority capability
2. Destroy CSAT's ballistic missile capability

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
1. Collect evidence against CSAT or the President of Pulau that may:
    - Prove CSAT's involvement in the death of the former President
    - Prove CSAT's involvement in the death of the former US Consul
    - Prove CSAT's bribery of leverage over the President of Pulau

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
No contractor equipment is to be left behind

Any CSAT personnel that sees you must be eliminated

You may dress in the style of the locals,
but that may limit the amount of equipment you can carry
briefing.situation:
CSAT expansion in the Pacific has been increasing at a fast pace.

Small island nations have been turning to CSAT for trade and protection treaties, turning away from the West.

Pulau has been a long time ally of the West, and has been a key strategic location for the West in the Pacific.

Despite the opinion of the islanders to remain neutral after the US removed troops from the island 4 years ago, their President has finalized a deal with CSAT, and their forces have moved into former US bases on the island.

The treaty gave CSAT the power to construct a new facility in Pulau, and this has been a breaking point for the islanders.

A group of rebels has begun a guerrilla war against CSAT forces.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: United States Central Intelligence Agency, Bundesnachrichtendienst
Location: Not Present

An unofficial NATO operation, led by the CIA and BND.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: CSAT
Location: Gurun Airfield, Monyet Airfield, Seliu

A CSAT preliminary force has been deployed to the island of Pulau.
They have been tasked with occupying the former US bases on the island, and preparing
construction of a new facility.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Pulau Rebels
Location: Scattered throughout the island

A group of rebels has begun a guerrilla war against CSAT forces.
They believe that the President of Pulau has been bribed by CSAT, and that he is
not acting in the best interest of the islanders.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Pulau Police
Location: Scattered throughout the island

A small police force, each officer may have different allegiances.
Due to the island's small population, many officers know the president personally.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Pulau Civilians

Islanders may have different allegiances, but it is not believed any are reporting to CSAT.

missions.name: Off The Ground
missions.summary: Contractors extract two VIPs from a collapsing regime

briefing.mission:
The democratic regime of Ruha is collapsing. After a series of scandals, the ruling party, the United Democratic Front (UDF), has lost public support. An election was called, and the UDF appears to have won by a narrow margin, but this is disputed by the opposition parties, and the Unit Nations has called for an independent investigation to be allowed to take place. The UDF has refused, and the opposition parties have called for a general strike and protests.

Last night, Raven Security operators arrived in Ruha, and have began to take control of government buildings, airports, and other key infrastructure. It is expected the Prime Minister will take authoritarian measures to suppress the protests.

Early this morning, a Raven Security team raided the homes of two opposition leaders, Paweł Kozlowski and Jan Lewandowski, where they are believed to still be held.

A wealthy businessman, Tymon Stolarski, who has been living outside of Ruha for the past few years, wants to see these opposition leaders freed and has hired Synixe Contractors to do so.

Vehicles and aircraft has been arranged by Mr. Stolarski, and we have been smuggled into the region using his business connections.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Extract Paweł Kozlowski
- Extract Jan Lewandowski

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Disrupt Raven Security operations
- Support local resistance fighters
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Tymon Stolarski
Location: Germany

Tymon Stolarski is a wealthy businessman with a vested interest in the political situation in Ruha. He is determined to see the release of the opposition leaders and is willing to pay handsomely for their extraction.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Raven Security
Location: Ruha

Raven Security is a private military company with ties to the Russian government. They are well-equipped and trained, specializing in urban warfare and counter-insurgency operations. Their primary objective is to maintain control over Ruha and suppress any opposition. They have been contracted by the United Democratic Front (UDF) to secure key locations and eliminate threats to their authority.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Local Resistance
Location: Ruha

Some citizens of Ruha have started to organize against the UDF and Raven Security. Due to the early stages of the conflict, they are not well-equipped or organized.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Most civilians in Ruha are staying in their homes, fearing the violence that has erupted in the streets. However, some are joining the protests against the UDF and Raven Security, risking their safety for the sake of democracy.

missions.name: Origins
missions.summary: Synixe Contractors remove mortar positions on a small island

briefing.old:
**Origins** **Employer**
Sahrani Military **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Insurgents

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Small town on the island, civilians are present **Mission**
We are tasked with destroying mortar sites being used to hit the edges of Sahrani mainland territory.

There may be support forces on the island, we should remove any additional threats on the island.

We have been provided with a small boat for transport.

missions.name: Pikavaellus
missions.summary: Synixe Contractors secure plans for a possible attack on a new NATO base in Finland

briefing.old:
**Pikavaellus** **Employer**
Finnish Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Anti-NATO Militia

FRIENDLY FORCES:
None

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present, and may relay information to enemy forces. **Mission**
A group of Anti-NATO militiamen are planning an operation against a newly setup joint NATO base in Finland.
Not wanting to involve NATO forces in a domestic issue so early into the new partnership, the Finnish government has hired Synixe Contractors to deal with the threat.

Finnish Inteligence services have provided us with three locations on an island where the militia is known to operate from. An insider has said that they have split some of their plans onto 4 yellow flashdrives.
The data has been sharded, and each flashdrive contains only a part of the plans. We need to find all 4 flashdrives to decode the plans, if don't secure all 4, they will not be able to decode the plans.
We will be inserting and extracting via boat, and will not have access to our vehicles.

missions.name: Pirates
missions.summary: Pirates have taken over a small island, contractors are tasked with removing them

briefing.mission:
Overnight, a large group of pirates stormed a Gendarmerie island, and have taken control of it.

We have been tasked with retaking the island, securing the pirates, and freeing any hostages that may be on the island.

The pirates are poorly equipped, and with no body armor, but they have rifles, grenades, and ARs, and are very numerous. Plan accordingly.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure the island
- Secure any hostages (if any, take them to ZH Tufani)
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Gendarmerie

Local Gendarmerie forces that are not equipped to handle the situation on their own.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Pirates
Location: Gendarmerie Island

The pirates are poorly equipped, and with no body armor, but they have rifles, grenades, and ARs, and are very numerous. They are demanding a large ransom for the hostages they have taken.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians will not be present on the Gendarmerie Island, as it is a military installation.

missions.name: Power Struggles
missions.summary: Contractors are hired to push out a powerful local figurehead encroaching on the capitol

briefing.mission:
Synixe Contractors has been hired to push back Sawt al-Ajadad forces that have secured towns to the north east of the capitol.

A JSI outpost was present in the area, but was abandoned after the region saw no activity for months, and other regions required additional support.

This has unfortunately allowed Sawt al-Ajadad to quickly and quietly push further south, and now they are within striking distance of the capitol.

We're being brough in as additional support to secure the region and push back Sawt al-Ajadad. It is not known with certainty if they are in the region, but we are also to secure Yasin al-Qassab, the leader of Sawt al-Ajadad if we find him.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Secure Ali Kala
- Secure Kaftar Kar
- Secure Kandah
- Secure Kandah Fort
- Secure Shahruk
- Secure the abandoned military outpost

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Capture Yasin al-Qassab
briefing.situation:
Farabad is still on the path to recovery after brutal conflicts in the region. The capitol is now secure and relatively safe, but outer regions still face instability as regional figures vie for power.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Farabad Joint Security Initiative "JSI"
Location: Farabad

The JSI is a coalition of regional and international forces working to stabilize the region.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Sawt al-Ajadad
Location: North Eastern region (Marked on map)

Sawt al-Ajadad is a group that has been holding power in various regions of Farabad, but recently have pushed very close to the capitol.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Farabad Joint Security Initiative "JSI"
Location: Farabad Green Zone, Various Outposts

Various different forces part of the JSI may be present in the area.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Location: Farabad

Many civilians have been displaced by the conflict, but some will be present in the area.

missions.name: Ransom Intervention
missions.summary: Contractors must work quickly to save a local businessman from a group looking to make a quick buck

briefing.old:
**Ransom Intervention** **Employer**
Alcot Insurance, Ruha Police **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Unknown

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present near the area of operations. **Mission**
A polish businessman named Krzysztof Eberhardt has been kidnapped by an unknown group of individuals. We have been hired by his insurance company to negotiate for his release, or recover him by force if necessary.

We have been given a location to meet the kidnappers. We are to meet them at the location, and attempt to negotiate for his release.

They have set the ransom at $2 million. Once we have Mr. Eberhardt, we are to bring him to the airport for extraction.

If safe to do so, we are to attempt to recover the ransom money as well and prevent the kidnappers from escaping with it.

missions.name: Shoulders
missions.summary: Contractors clear out canyons of insurgents

briefing.old:
**Shoulders** **Employer**
Suursaari Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Militia

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors **Mission**
Contractors have been hired to clear several canyons hosting illicit drug operations.

missions.name: Straglers
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with removing a group of hostiles and rescuing civilian workers

briefing.mission:
An unknown force has been making incursions into northern Norway and setting up unknown devices.

They've recently setup a device in the town of Ulvik, and reportedly have taken civilian hostages.

At this time, the enemy doesn't seem to know we're aware of their presence in Ulvik.

We've landed at a small dual purpose highway / airstrip, 3 offroads are waiting for us.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Rescue the hostages
- Destroy the device in Ulvik
- Secure the town of Ulvik

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Determine the enemy force's origin
briefing.situation:
An unknown contracted force has been reported by locals to be setting up unknown devices in the northern fjords.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Norwegian Government
Location: Norway

The Norwegian Government has contracted us to investigate and eliminate the unknown forces in the north west.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Unknown
Location: Ulvik

Unknown forces that have been incuring in the region and setting up unknown devices.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Very sparse population, but present in the town of Ulvik. Potential hostages.

missions.name: Sudenhalla
missions.summary: Contractors clear out an area where a group of bandits are hiding

briefing.mission:
A group of radical bandits have been causing trouble in the area, stopping vehicles, robbing industrial sites, ransoming civilians, and causing general chaos. The Government has been unable to effectively deal with the proble, and has contracted Synixe to clear out the area they hide in.

The bandits are always on the move, and quick to reinforce each other. The effective use of transport and recon will be essential to our success.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Clear the marked area of all bandits

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Do not let fighting reach the civilian settlements
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Virojoki Government
Location: Virojoki

The Virojoki Government is a local authority struggling to maintain control over the region. They only have standard law enforcement, which are not numerous enough to deal with the rapid moving bandits.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Bandit Group
Location: Marked Area, North West of Virojoki

Starting as a "defensive" group to teach young men survival skills, they have become a radicalized and violent group. Equipped with last gen Russian weapons, they are well armed and quick to move around the forest.

missions.name: Toisnokavaellus
missions.summary: Contractors collect intel from the sites of an isolated and dangerous cult

briefing.mission:
The Finnish Armed Forces are looking to gain intel and inflict a blow on the operations of a cultist group, swaying more people from joining and causing some of their current membership to reconsider.

We'll be inserting onto the island via boat, no vehicles are available. It is believed that vehicles will also be rare on the island, due to the expense of transport. While the cultists are essentially in open rebellion, the focus is to gather intel. Mission restrictions take priority over secondary objectives.

Police Intelligence has provided us with some observations from satellite and drones:

- Confirmed to have a small fleet of trucks used for construction
- At least two armed trucks seen used in their "drills"
- They have communications equipment
- They have patrols of 6-12 people armed with light weapons
- Sites are guarded by large teams with sophisticated weapons

We are tasked with hitting 3 sites, observed to be of high importance to high-ranking members. Gather all intel at these sites.

Their leader, Valaistunut Yksi (The Enlightened One), is confirmed to be near the sites but his exact location is unknown. He has 4 elite guards and is himself well armed. If spotted, he is to be secured or eliminated.

We will be moving in at night, but the Sun will already be rising. The Enlightened One should not be on the move at this hour, but the cults does have night patrols.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Collect intel on the cult's operations from their sites

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Inflict damage on their operations
- Secure or eliminate The Enlightened One

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- The use of powerful explosives is not permitted
- Damage to civil infrastructure is not permitted
- Only engage those enganging, once fired upon
- Disengage if the cultists disengage
briefing.situation:
We're deploying to a Finnish island in the Baltic Sea, near Russia. The island, recently hardly populated, has been taken over by a cult backed by Russia.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Finnish Armed Forces

Recently having joined NATO, target of Russian aggression.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Russia-Backed Cultists

Formerly a fringe group, they have grown a large amount since Finland joined NATO. They are armed with a mix of modern Russian, Soviet, and civilian equipment.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
The island had a small population historically, but now essentially all civilians not associated with the cult have moved off the island.
The island is populated almost entirely by cultists. They have many small villages and camps.

missions.name: Truth Wears No Uniform
missions.summary: Contractors assist with a threat from a man known to the Gendarmerie

briefing.mission:
The Gendarmerie received a message from a local man known to police, Kahakuhale Kingi. He has previously been arrested multiple times for disrupting public order, refusing lawful orders, uttering threats, and other minor offenses.

The message stated:

> Today is the day of reckoning. Send your most useful idiots, the ones who are willing to die for a cause they don't understand.
> The natural consequences of your actions must be accelerated, you won't get to die peacefully in your beds.
> You won't get to know peace while sowing the seeds of pain and suffering.
> You know where I am, I am waiting, come receive your gifts.

The Gendarmerie says Kingi became very vocal against the government and the police after an industrial site was approved to be built next to his land 23 years ago. At that time he started a protest movement that gained public support, and was jailed multiple times, but often without official charges.

The Gendarmerie has been monitoring Kingi for the last 23 years, but he has never displayed any suspicious or violent behavior, and has kept to himself since the protest movement against industrialization of the islands ended many years ago.

Due to the nature of the message however, the Gendarmerie is taking it very seriously. They have requested our assistance, as they are concerned that Kingi may be planning to attack the industrial site with explosive devices, which they have no experience in dealing with.

Dock records show that Kingi has recently imported several large packages, but the manifests are missing from the dock records. We are advised to proceed with extreme caution.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Bring Kingi in for questioning
- Investigate the industrial site

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Follow any leads from the investigation
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Gendarmerie
Location: Emerald Islands, however, not present in the AO

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Kahakuhale Kingi
Location: His small farm residence, south east of Vanhav, east of the industrial site

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians will be present in the area, no notice is being published to avoid panic.

missions.name: Walk Him Out
missions.summary: Contractors must secure and extract David Morely after a resort town was raided

briefing.old:
**Walk Him Out** **Employer**
David Morely **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Militia, known to operate near coastal towns for shipments in and out of the island

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
Pulua Security Forces

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians may be present in some towns, but unlikely to still be near the AO **Mission**
An American man named David Morely was temporarily residing in Pulau, in the resort town of Nirwana. Last night the town was raided by local militia, and David was taken hostage. The small Pulau Security Forces are unable to mount a rescue operation, and associates of David have hired Synixe to rescue him.

Primary Objectives
- Secure Mr. Morely's laptop from his house in Nirwana or the local militia
- Secure David Morely and bring him to Synixe's FOB

Secondary Objectives
- Secure David's Laptop from his house in Nirwana or the local militia

missions.name: Against the Current
missions.summary: Contractors push back the rebels

briefing.mission:
One of the new plantations of the Jaya Group has been torched by one of the groups of Free Papua Movement, calling for the end of the extractive economy of the region.

The plantation was briefly shelled from across the river, the suspected areas are marked in blue. Rebel captured by company's private security has divulged information that the rebels utilize the river and the nearby areas to transport equipment and personel around the area, using old trails and fishing piers. From the rebel's testimony they are 3 groups, camping only few hundred meters in land but they move their camps every few days, last known position of one is near the long island.

Synixe has been contracted to find the mortars and destroy the camps.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Find and destroy two mortars
- Clear out 3 rebel encampments
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Jaya Group
Location: West Papua

One of the companies involved in plantations all across western and eastern Papua.
Recently heavily targeted by native population for destroying the land in Tonle valley

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Free Papua Movement

Since its inception the separitist movement has attempted diplomatic dialague and taken partisan action against both Indonesian-controlled west Papua and more recently ,disapointed by the pro-corporate stance of Independent State of Papua New Guiea (PNG), in the east part of the Island. They are light equiped miltia force, armed with weapons of PNG supplied from livonia and CSAT supplied weapons of Indonesia, they use river as the main means of moving troops and supplies

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Indonesian Army
Location: Hill 114

Regulars dont leave the base. By agreement with Jaya Group you are allowed to rest and reequip there.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians have fled the area after the plantation was torched.

missions.name: Caribou at War
missions.summary: Contractors rescue finnish mayor

briefing.mission:
Provincial government has lost control over the area. Insurgents have seized a mobilization depot and have taken mayor Pekka Mustonen hostage. The local group is led by our target - Riikka Nieminem.

According to the metadata on video shared on social media in early morning, they must still be in the area of Heikkola. Rikka was seen brandishing a pistol in white suit, while the mayor was seen in purple shirt. GPS location from video has been marked on the map.

The captured armored vehicle is German made Wiesel armored weapons carrier, it has been seen in pictures in the recently overtaken villages in the north, marked in red. Its believed to be still there or back in Heikkola. Your task is to destroy it.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Rescue mayor Pekka Mustonen
- Secure Riikka Nieminen
- Destroy captured Wiesel Armored Weapons Carrier

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Don't destroy residential buildings in the towns
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Kainuu Province Governor

Loyal to the government after abolishment of the Sámi Council. Has been dealing with policing of the widespread riots, but with his police force in disarray and central government refusing to commit more resources, he has no tools to contain the crisis.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Sami Confederation

After abolishment of Sámi Council and its cultural self protection, group is seeking international recognition and ascension to CSAT.
Armed with mostly privately acquired weapons and some Finnish service equipment seized from mobilization storage. From same storage they have seized one armored weapons carrier.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Finnish Army
Location: FOB

National government has so far only assembled forces with hold orders, waiting for situation to develop.

Name: Finnish Police

There still may be friendly police forces left in the area.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: CSAT

Denied any involvement so far.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>

Heikkola has been evacuated. Towns nearby may still have significant civlian presence

missions.name: Legacy of Empire
missions.summary: Contractors help British to restore order

briefing.mission:
Recently achieved sale and transfers of equipment from British Armed Forces to bolster old and antiquated equipment of the republic's army have lit the fire under the long held belief of the opposition party, that the country should be aligning itself with its closest neighbour not the old colonial overlord.

The opposition turned miltia have raided armories and have stolen one of the shipments from the port. Port's warehouse facility may offer clues to where have it has been taken. Many government soldiers have gone MIA (presumed deserters). There have been shots fired at british servicemembers leaving many wounded and one KIA. The british government cannot afford to commit more security forces to the island because of upcoming election campaign.

Synixe has been contracted to help the government recover from recent setbacks.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Rescue BAF squad from encirclement
- Find and secure stolen heavy weapons
<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Bring back stolen heavy weapons to FOB
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: BAF
Location: Atlantic Island

British forces use their post-colonial ties to the island for amphibious training. The Island has small permanent garrison used as liason and for training local troops.


<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Third Way Party
Location: Atlantic Island

Local movement based on restoring precolonial identity of the Island. They have been running on a platform of removing british presence on the Island.
Recently, in the north of the island, they formed an armed militia demanding government to step down.

They are armed with recently stolen new and old surplus equipment from British forces including light armor vests, as well as equipment smuggled in. Limited to footpatrols and civilian vehicles

Symbol of rebelion is green armband.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Government Forces
Location: Checkpoints

Armed forces of the Republic, they are unreliable and currently kept away from direct fights.

They are armed with new and old surplus equipment from United Kingdom.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>

Supporters of government are docile and rarely leave well populated areas amid the rebellion

missions.name: Valley of the Damned
missions.summary: Contractors stop execution of journalist

briefing.mission:
During recent push of the Northern Alliance, AFP's war correspondent and his cameraman have been captured during mass surrender in town of Kushkak.

They have demanded that the press agency publish their manifesto to the world. The agency partners have obliged but the group demanded a live show that had to be cut off midway through.

Pierre Louette has been executed on internet livestream just 30 minutes ago and threat that Andrew will be executed at 16:30 local time, with demands to resume broadcast. The location was in some kind of walled complex near the river, we are trying to get fix on that location. We have very limited intel going in, few of the suspected and known enemy locations have been marked on map.

Synixe has been contracted to rescue the journalist and bring back the body of his cameraman.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Rescue Andrew Beatty

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Find and bring back body of Pierre Louette
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Agence France-Presse

International news agency headquartered in Paris. Their war correspondent and his cameraman have gone missing after being separated from government forces during recent offensive.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Northern Alliance

Post-Mujahideen faction strongly opposed to Taliban-led Kabul Government mostly composed of ethnicities from northern Afghanistan such as Tajiks and Uzbeks. Mostly a militia force, with small arms and technicals with few captured MRAPs.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: ION
Location: Marked outposts

Private security for international companies interested in working with Taliban government. They are currently formulating exit plans from the area. By agreement with AFP they will provide us access to their compound's technical resources.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan
Location: Mantiq

Government forces are poorly trained and have pulled back from the area. We have the required permissions from the government but we don't know what happens if the push comes to shove.
<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>

Civilians present throughout the area.

missions.name: Red Sky at Night
missions.summary: Contractors provide security at the Blue Pearl industrial port

briefing.mission:
We have been hired to provide security for the Blue Pearl industrial port due to an increasing threat from Syndikat.

While Syndikat activity has always been present, attacks against Daltgreen facilities have increased in recent times. Three weeks ago, pirates attacked a Daltgreen vessel, forcing the crew to abandon it. Last week, a bomb was detonated at the Red Spring surface mine, injuring three Daltgreen workers.

We are tasked with staffing a security shift at the Blue Pearl industrial port from 0400 to 0600. We are responsible for securing the entire premises. There should be relatively few Daltgreen workers and activity during these early morning hours.

There are two Gendarmerie guard posts at either entrance to the port. There is an additional Gendarmerie guard post to the south on the road that leads to the mine. A couple of Genarmerie sentries will be patrolling the perimeter.

At this time, Daltgreen does not find it necessary for us to sweep the whole premises for bombs. Daltgreen believes they have had enough security at the port to prevent that threat so far, unlike the surface mine. The Gendarmerie and workers on site will have the ability to reach us by radio, if someting does arise.

There is an important naval shipment approaching from the east that is expected to arrive at the port at 0500 and leave by 0530. We are to see to its safe arrival and departure from the AO.

Daltgreen has given us rooftop access for the sole office building at the port. Any door on the ground should allow us to get in by using the keypad. We are allowed to utilize the rooftop at our own discretion.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Maintain a security presence at the Blue Pearl industrial port until at least 0600

Ensure the safe arrival and departure of the scheduled naval shipment

Protect Daltgreen personnel, assets, and infrastructure from any threats

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Assist Daltgreen workers with any logistical, engineering, or medical tasks whenver possible

Assist any Gendarmerie stationed at the Blue Peal industrial port when threats arise

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
Do not impede civilian naval traffic
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Daltgreen Mining and Exploration
Location: All over Tanoa and its satellite islands

Daltgreen Mining and Exploration owns several facilities on the island of Tanoa, including but not limited to the Blue Pearl industrial port.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Syndikat
Location: Primarily spread out through Tanoa's satellite islands, with limited presence on the main island

Syndikat is a local crime organization carrying out several illegal operations in the region such as smuggling and piracy. Recently, Syndikat has been operating in a more paramilitary fashion with more powerful equipment, posing a more signficant threat to the Gendarmerie. They are expected to fire on any Gendarmerie or forces aligned with them on sight.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Gendarmerie 
Location: Primarily concentrated on Tanoa's main island, with limited presence on satellite islands

The Gendarmerie are the militarized police force of Tanoa. They exist to keep the peace and combat Syndikat operations.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Tanoa Locals
Location: All over Tanoa and its satellite islands

Civlians continue to live their normal lives depsite the Syndikat activity, attempting to avoid conflict. Civilians are allowed through the port, but only on the main road.

<font color='#996D33'>TERRAIN AND WEATHER CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Terrain: Industrial port surrounded by dense jungle
Weather: Dense early morning fog which is expected to persist

missions.name: Help Is On The Way
missions.summary: Contractors have been tasked with rescuing VIPs for evacuation amidst a civil war nearing its boiling point

briefing.mission:
Contractors have been hired to rescue VIPs in the region of Anizay after a cease in evacuation operations by both NATO and UNA.

As such, a meeting point has been established at FOB Nauzad's main barracks to find information provided by UNA on the VIPs to be rescued.

Contractors are to head to the meeting point, retrieve any and all relevant information on the VIPs, and get them to safety back at FOB Nauzad by any means necessary.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Establish contact with UNA at FOB Nauzad and retrieve any and all relevant intel on the VIPs
- Assess contractor capacity to carry out the objectives whether fully or partially
- Rescue VIPs and bring them to safety

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Eliminate any and all Anizay Freedom Insurgency combatants
- Assist UNA and the Anizay Militia whenever possible
- Protect and defend civilians from harm
briefing.situation:
A socio-economical crisis has been brewing in the region of Anizay, and as a result, a civil war ensued. NATO had been assisting its allies and associates in evacuations in the weeks leading up to the major pullout, but now all that is left is some remnants of a few UNA forces still stationed at FOB Nauzad and FOB Obeh, while those who missed the evacuations have been left behind scrambling for a way to escape.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
United States Department of State

The United States Department of State has outsourced its security operations to Synixe Contractors due to a limitation in jurisdictions after the events leading up to the NATO pullout.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Anizay Freedom Insurgency

The Anizay Freedom Insurgency has been trying to gain leverage over both national and international sources in an attempt to counter many new foreign relations and reforms in Anizay, as such, they have taken to violence as a means to promote their message and pursue a revolution, having started to go after some notorious VIPs in the region of Anizay who have been left behind during the NATO pullout, and subsequently, the start of UNA's recess in the region.

They are often seen wearing robes and turbans, and seem to be equipped with surplus equipment consisting of small arms and some statics.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
United Assistance (UNA)
Location(s): FOB Nauzad, FOB Obeh

United Assistance has been in charge of peacekeeping operations in Anizay. As of recent events, both their resources and efforts have diminished, and their evacuation operations have ceased, leading up to Synixe Contractors involvement.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Anizay Militia

The Anizay Militia has been at war with the Anizay Freedom Insurgency ever since the discontent in the region reached its boiling point. They have access to armored vehicles and military equipment previously provided by other foreign nations in support of the ongoing course of Anizay, and they are often seen wearing helmets, uniforms, and military garments.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present in the area and may or may not be in support of either Synixe Contractors, UNA, Anizay Militia, or the Anizay Freedom Insurgency.

missions.name: Same Day Delivery
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with delivering food and medical supplies to a series of designated IDAP camps

briefing.mission:
The situation in greater Takistan is tense, and many locals have begun to arm themselves with surplus equipment to defend themselves and their homes after recent pullouts. IDAP has entered the scene in an attempt to help out those in need by providing food and medical supplies.

Recent conflict has left behind remnants of war across many of the fields and mountains of the region, all parties present are advised to stick to roads and urban areas in order to avoid unexploded ordnance. Additionally, the terrain is rugged and will hinder vehicle performance.

Caution is advised when navigating with the Strategic Map, as the map provided may be out of date.

Upon completion of the tasking, contractors shall recount their task completion at the whiteboard of the base and assess their success.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Deliver specific supplies requested by IDAP to the designated IDAP camps within the open tents.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Eliminate any hostile forces in the AO

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- Contractors are NOT allowed to brandish weapons within IDAP facilities.
- Contractors are NOT allowed within the airfield.
- Contractors are NOT allowed to use the airspace for aircraft or drones.
- Contractors SHOULD avoid open fields and mountains due to unexploded ordnance presence.
- Contractors MUST minimize collateral damage.
- Contractors MUST place food and medical supplies inside the open tents at each IDAP camp.
- Contractors MUST properly identify targets as hostiles before engaging them on a per-individual basis.
briefing.situation:
Contractors have been hired by Vrana Corporation to assist in the transport of food and medical supplies to designated IDAP camps in order to assist the locals.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Vrana Corporation
Location: Montreal

Vrana Corporation is a leading biotech firm specializing in genetic engineering, advanced robotics, and military technologies. Known for secretive projects, it thrives on lucrative defense contracts and pushes the boundaries of science, often raising ethical concerns. In light of recent events, they have started a push towards funding and aiding NGOs to better their public image.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Armed Takistani Locals
Location: Towns and villages

There are armed Takistani locals in the area of operations who are against the involvement of Contractors in the area of operations. They camouflage themselves amongs the local population and act opportunistically.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: International Development and Aid Project
Location: IDAP camps

The International Development and Aid Project (IDAP) are currently trying to provide the locals with food and supplies in the middle of a siege and terror of a brewing conflict.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Takistani National Army
Location: Airfield

The Takistani National Army has a few soldiers stationed at the local Airfield. They are neutral to contractors unless provoked.

Name: Armed Takistani Locals
Location: Towns and villages

There are armed Takistani locals in the area of operations who may or may not be in support of Contractor presence in the area of operations.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
